_header: Come over the woods fair and green
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 322.
Subjects: dialogues; lovers, dialogues; women, as speakers/narrators
_description: An amorous dialogue with gathering flowers imagery — ten 8-line Monk’s Tale stanzas with refrains, ‘for conforth ys non alone to be’ and ‘alone’

BodRawC813.First Lines:
Come ouer the woodes fair and grenethe goodly mayde þat lustye
                    wenche…
BodRawC813.Last Lines:
…and ye shall fynde ytt for your prowefor comforthe ys non
                    alone to be
